name: Gough Map of Britain (c.1360)
description: Oldest surviving road map of Great Britain. Shows 'Mamcestre' with road connections. Held at the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
notes:
Bodleian Library MS. Gough Gen. Top. 16.
Dated c.1360 (possibly with later additions).
Shows roads as red lines — earliest known British road map.
Manchester appears as 'Mamcestre' on road network.
High-res original: 10,400x5,427px.
IIIF manifest has TWO canvases: original + georectified version (1000x1500px).
Original image: https://iiif.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/iiif/image/740b0937-0500-4692-a970-ba801e4a1f24
Georectified image: https://iiif.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/iiif/image/7804decf-563c-4039-a02d-9f834c4bac9b
Scholarly edition: https://goughmap.uk/ (offline since Nov 2024).
CC BY-NC-SA 3.0 license.

NEXT STEPS for Stage 3+:
Georeference in Allmaps Editor using the IIIF manifest:
https://editor.allmaps.org/#/collection?url=https://iiif.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/iiif/manifest/e4dc07a6-3ec8-414a-aa92-2e9815f93276.json
Use the georectified canvas for simpler control points.
Once annotated, Allmaps generates XYZ tiles automatically → Stage 4.
